text.div:
MakingEHRDataMoreAvailableToResearchAndPublicHealth

The official URL for this implementation guide is: 

http://hl7.org/fhir/us/medmorph/ImplementationGuide/hl7.fhir.us.medmorph

MedMorph describes a framework to enable submission of data from healthcare organizations to public health and research organizations.

name: MakingEHRDataMoreAvailableToResearchAndPublicHealth
title: Making EHR Data More available for Research and Public Health (MedMorph)
publisher: HL7 International - Public Health Work Group
description: MedMorph describes a framework to enable submission of data from healthcare organizations to public health and research organizations.

grouping.name: Behavior: Capability Statements
grouping.description: The following artifacts define the specific capabilities that different types of systems are expected to have in order to comply with this implementation guide.  Systems conforming to this implementation guide are expected to declare conformance to one or more of the following capability statements.

grouping.name: Behavior: Operation Definitions
grouping.description: These are custom operations that can be supported by and/or invoked by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Structures: Resource Profiles
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR resources for systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Structures: Extension Definitions
grouping.description: These define constraints on FHIR data types for systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Value Sets
grouping.description: These define sets of codes used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Terminology: Code Systems
grouping.description: These define new code systems used by systems conforming to this implementation guide

grouping.name: Example: Example Instances
grouping.description: These are example instances that show what data produced and consumed by systems conforming with this implementation guide might look like

resource.description: Example of a Reporting Bundle containing Message Header and Content Bundle

resource.name: Generate Anonymized Bundle
resource.description: Generates an anonymized bundle taking an instance of a Bundle containing Protected Health Information (PHI)/personally identifiable information (PII) data. The anonymization algorithm to be used is left to the implementers of the operation.

resource.name: US Public Health Message Type Codes
resource.description: The US Public Health Message Header Events CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying types of messages being exchanged.

resource.name: US Public Health Message Types
resource.description: The US Public Health Message Types Value Set is a 'starter set' of codes for uniquely identifying messages in MessageHeader instances contained within a reporting bundle.

resource.name: Generate De-Identified Bundle
resource.description: Generates a de-identified bundle taking an instance of a Bundle containing PHI/PII data. The de-identification algorithm to be used is left to the implementers of the operation.

resource.name: US Public Health TriggerDefinition Named Events
resource.description: The US Public Health TriggerDefinition NamedEvents CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying named events to subscribe to in clinical workflows.

resource.name: US Public Health TriggerDefinition NamedEvent
resource.description: The US Public Health TriggerDefinition NamedEvent Value Set is a 'starter set' of codes for uniquely identifying named events in TriggerDefinition instances contained within a PlanDefinition.

resource.name: Generate Pseudonymized Bundle
resource.description: Generates a pseudonymized bundle taking an instance of a Bundle containing PHI/PII data. The pseudonymization algorithm to be used is left to the implementers of the operation.

resource.name: US Public Health PlanDefinition Action
resource.description: The US Public Health PlanDefinition Action Value Set is a 'starter set' of codes for uniquely identifying actions in PlanDefinition instances.

resource.name: US Public Health Reporting Bundle
resource.description: Bundle Resource profile for exchanging one of public health messages, knowledge artifacts or content.

resource.name: US Public Health Content Bundle
resource.description: Bundle Resource profile for exchanging public health messages, knowledge artifacts or content.

resource.name: Generate Re-Identified Bundle
resource.description: Generates a re-identified bundle taking an instance of a Bundle containing PHI/PII data. The re-identification algorithm to be used is left to the implementers of the operation.

resource.name: US Public Health Response Message Processing Status Codes
resource.description: The US Public Health Message Processing Status Codes Value Set is a 'starter set' of codes for identifying response message processing status for each message that was previously submitted from clinical care to PHA or Research Organizations.

resource.name: US Public Health CodeSystem for Response Message Processing Status Codes
resource.description: The US Public Health Response Message Processing Status CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying response message processing status codes.

resource.name: MedMorph Knowledge Artifact Repository
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''Knowledge Artifact Repository'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.     This role is responsible for allowing creation, modification, and hosting of the Knowledge Artifacts.

resource.name: MedMorph Trusted Third Party
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''Trusted Third Party'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.     This role is responsible for receiving messages and forwarding messages from clinical care to PHA/Research Organization and send responses back from PHA/Research Organization to clinical care.

resource.name: US Public Health FHIR Query Pattern Extension
resource.description: Supports communicating the FHIR query for a given data requirement. The query is server-specific, and will need to be created as informed by a CapabilityStatement. The $data-requirements operation should be extended to be able to provide an Endpoint or CapabilityStatement to provide this information. If no endpoint or capability statement is provided, the capability statement of the server performing the operation is used. This is not a resolveable URL, and that it will contain 1) No base canonical (so it's a relative query), and 2) Parameters using tokens that are denoted using double-braces and the context parameters are dependent solely on the subjectType, according to the following: Patient: context.patientId, Practitioner: context.practitionerId, Organization: context.organizationId, Location: context.locationId, Device: context.deviceId

resource.name: MedMorph EHR
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''EHR'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.     This role is responsible for allowing creation, modification and deletion of Subscriptions and allows searching and retrieval of resources using US Core APIs.

resource.name: MedMorph Backend Service App
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''Backend Service App'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.

resource.name: MedMorph Public Health Authority
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''Public Health Authority'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.     This role is responsible for defining Knowledge Artifacts, receiving public health reports, and submitting responses back to clinical care organizations.

resource.name: MedMorph Trust Service Provider
resource.description: This profile defines the expected capabilities of the ''Trust Service Provider'' actor when conforming to the MedMorph Architecture Implementation Guide.     This role is responsible for allowing creation, modification, and hosting of the Knowledge Artifacts.

resource.name: US Public Health CodeSystem for ValueSet Use Context Codes
resource.description: The US Public Health UseContext CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying use context codes in ValueSet.

resource.name: US Public Health PlanDefinition Action Codes
resource.description: The US Public Health PlanDefinition Actions CodeSystem is a 'starter set' of codes supported for identifying actions in PlanDefinition.

resource.name: USPublicHealthSpecificationBundle
resource.description: Bundle Resource profile for exchanging one of MedMorph messages, knowledge artifacts or content.

resource.name: USPublicHealthResponseBundle
resource.description: Bundle Resource profile for exchanging one of MedMorph messages, knowledge artifacts or content.

resource.name: ResponseMessageStatus
resource.description: Indicates the result of processing messages submitted from clinical care to Public Health Authority (PHA) or Research Organizations.

resource.name: USPublicHealthCommunication
resource.description: This is the Communication Resource profile for the IG.

resource.name: USPublicHealthEndpoint
resource.description: This is the Endpoint Resource profile for the IG used to specify receivers addresses

resource.name: USPublicHealthSurveyPractitionerGroup
resource.description: Group Resource profile for specifying survey participant groups, research groups.

resource.name: ResearchParticipantGroup
resource.description: Group Resource profile for specifying survey participant groups, research groups.

resource.name: DataEncrypted
resource.description: Indicates whether the data in the content bundle is encrypted or not.

resource.name: MessageProcessingCategory
resource.description: Indicates how systems have to deal with messages in terms of duplicates, lack of responses.

resource.name: USPublicHealthMessageHeader
resource.description: This is the MessageHeader Resource profile for the IG.

resource.name: EncounterCloseSubscriptionTopic
resource.description: This is the Backport Subscription Resource profile for the IG used to specify encounter-start Subscription Topic

resource.name: EncounterStartSubscriptionTopic
resource.description: This is the Backport Subscription Resource profile for the IG used to specify encounter-start Subscription Topic

resource.name: USPublicHealthNamedEventType
resource.description: Indicates the types of named events to subscribe to from the EHR.

resource.name: ReceiverAddress
resource.description: Indicates the address where the report has to be sent.

resource.name: AuthorSignature
resource.description: Indicates the signature of the author who created the PlanDefinition.

resource.name: AsyncIndicator
resource.description: True indicates that the messages resulting from the PlanDefinition are expected to be processed asynchronously.

resource.name: ExpectedResponseTime
resource.description: Indicates the maximum time the sender has to wait to get a response, beyond which the message is assumed to have failed to reach the destination.

resource.name: USPublicHealthPlanDefinition
resource.description: This is the PlanDefinition Resource profile for the IG.

resource.name: USPublicHealthValueSet
resource.description: This is the ValueSet Resource profile for the IG for specifying various valuesets to be used in public health reporting.
